intro: Cieca colubrina, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, blue-violet flowers that appear in late summer. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is drought-tolerant once established. Cieca colubrina is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
